pr_title: Add vetoed-bean support to metrics CDI extension

timeline.message:
Convert tests to use the new infrastructure

Signed-off-by: tim.quinn@oracle.com <tim.quinn@oracle.com>
Fix scope of Helidon test JUnit5 artifact
Use ProcessManagedBean instead of ProcessAnnotatedType to actually define metrics

Convert tests to use the new infrastructure

Signed-off-by: tim.quinn@oracle.com <tim.quinn@oracle.com>
Use ProcessManagedBean instead of ProcessAnnotatedType to actually define metrics

Report ignored (vetoed) classes, if any, at FINE level

Signed-off-by: tim.quinn@oracle.com <tim.quinn@oracle.com>

timeline.bodyText: Need to adjust this comment to match the code below it.
timeline.author: ljnelson

timeline.bodyText: Strictly speaking this is not reliable as other observers can add the @Interceptor annotation programmatically later.
timeline.author: ljnelson

replies.bodyText: I've left that but added a second check in the ProcessManagedBean observer, just in case.
replies.author: tjquinno

timeline.bodyText: Oh, interesting; I guess Jandex takes meta-annotations into account?
timeline.author: ljnelson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -364,65 +440,55 @@ private void processInjectionPoints(@Observes ProcessInjectionPoint<?, ?> pip) {
     }
 
     /**
-     * Records the need to add a {@code SyntheticSimplyTimed} annotation to each JAX-RS endpoint method.
+     * Adds a {@code SyntheticSimplyTimed} annotation to each JAX-RS endpoint method.
      *
      * @param pat the {@code ProcessAnnotatedType} for the type containing the JAX-RS annotated methods
      */
     private void recordSimplyTimedForRestResources(@Observes
-                                                   @WithAnnotations({GET.class, PUT.class, POST.class, HEAD.class, OPTIONS.class,
-                                                                            DELETE.class, PATCH.class})
+                                                   @WithAnnotations({HttpMethod.class})

replies.bodyText: I've switched back just in case there is some oddness that hasn't surfaced in the testing so far.
replies.author: tjquinno

timeline.bodyText: Better to use pmb.getBean().getScope() unless I'm missing something.
timeline.author: ljnelson
ljnelson

timeline.bodyText: (This is fine; when I commented on this previously, I didn't mean necessarily to remove the HttpMethod annotation and replace it with the list of options—it was more just that I was surprised that a meta-annotation like that would be processed by @WithAnnotations.)
timeline.author: ljnelson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -445,7 +450,8 @@ private void processInjectionPoints(@Observes ProcessInjectionPoint<?, ?> pip) {
      * @param pat the {@code ProcessAnnotatedType} for the type containing the JAX-RS annotated methods
      */
     private void recordSimplyTimedForRestResources(@Observes
-                                                   @WithAnnotations({HttpMethod.class})
+                                                   @WithAnnotations({GET.class, PUT.class, POST.class, HEAD.class, OPTIONS.class,

replies.bodyText: Yeah, the original code had the list of individual annotations and that worked fine. I happened to see @HttpMethod in the def for Get (I think) and thought I'd try it and it seemed to work. But that is not related to the functional change at the heart of this PR so it's probably best to not make that change...at least now.
replies.author: tjquinno
